Key Match Events: Cade Povich pitched shutout ball into the sixth
Ryan O'Hearn and Colton Cowser homered
Post-Match Reflections: The Twins knew the Tigers had won and the Royals had lost, meaning a victory would keep their playoff hopes alive. But they could muster only two hits through the first eight innings and trailed 7-0.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles wrapped up the top American League wild-card spot, and will host either Detroit or Kansas City in the opening round next week.
Others: Povich (3-9) gave up only two hits and walked one while striking out two in 5⅔ innings. The rookie left-hander was making his first career start against the team that selected him in the third round of the 2021 draft. The Twins traded him to Baltimore a year later as the centerpiece of a package used to acquire reliever Jorge Lopez.
Twins starter Pablo López (15-10) gave up two runs, six hits, three walks and had eight strikeouts in 5⅔ innings.
